channel.title: 3 questions!
channel.description:
1. How can i change a new players spawn location? 2. How can i change what armour a new player has? 3. Can i make it so that all new players start with a certain amount of money in their inventory?
Thanks in advance! :)

item.title: 3 questions!
item.dc:creator: @gigabyt3r gigabyt3r
item.description:
@gigabyt3r wrote:

Ok i changed what you start with & pasted in

   [code] // Giving the player an unique look
    playerEquipment[playerHat]    = 2581;
    playerEquipment[playerCape]   = 6570;
    playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = 6585;
    playerEquipment[playerChest]  = 3140;
    playerEquipment[playerShield] = 1187;
    playerEquipment[playerLegs]   = 4087;
    playerEquipment[playerHands]  = 7462;
    playerEquipment[playerFeet]   = 2577;
    playerEquipment[playerRing]   = 6735;
    playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1;
    playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 4151;[/code]

But when i login with a new char im still wearing full bronze like before

and thats max that can’t be any higher

item.title: 3 questions!
item.dc:creator: @bakatool bakatool
item.description:
@bakatool wrote:

to change new player spawns go to Player.java and

look for coordinates there.

//these are new player spawn coordinates.

    // the first call to updateThisPlayerMovement() will craft the proper initialization packet
    teleportToX = 3253;    // 3072;
    teleportToY = 3434;    // 3312;

question 2 same place… Player.java

thats full dragon/whip/warrior ring + fire cape

        // Giving the player an unique look
        playerEquipment[playerHat]    = 2581;
        playerEquipment[playerCape]   = 6570;
        playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = 6585;
        playerEquipment[playerChest]  = 3140;
        playerEquipment[playerShield] = 1187;
        playerEquipment[playerLegs]   = 4087;
        playerEquipment[playerHands]  = 7462;
        playerEquipment[playerFeet]   = 2577;
        playerEquipment[playerRing]   = 6735;
        playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1;
        playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = 4151;

those are starter weapon/armours

3rd question is also same place its all there.

[code] for (int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++) { // Setting player items
playerItems[i] = 0;
}

    for (int i = 0; i < playerItemsN.length; i++) {    // Setting Item amounts
        playerItemsN[i] = 0;
    }[/code]

that gives you a nice blank inventory with 0 amount of items

after thats done.

Read full topic
